meanings.definition: An atom or molecule with a net electric charge due to the loss or gain of one or more electrons.
meanings.sent1: The ion moved towards the oppositely charged electrode.
meanings.sent2: The sodium ion is positively charged.
meanings.sent3: The ion threw a party to celebrate its newfound charge.
meanings.sent4: In the world of ions, opposites attract and likes repel.
meanings.sent5: The ion danced in the solution, its charge lighting up the room.

meanings.sent1: The hydrogen ion is a key player in acid-base reactions.
meanings.sent2: An ion can be positive or negative depending on its charge.
meanings.sent3: The ion wore a tiny crown to show off its charge.
meanings.sent4: The ion zipped through the particle accelerator, leaving a trail of energy.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the ion's charge was visible as a bright glow.
